body: Seems like neovim sets a "*.tf" file to filetype "tf".

comment_data.body:
This is wrong. If filetype=tf that means the detection failed: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/5e5b004da44c7075ed1e20ae9d05ab09c6f2ac58/runtime/lua/vim/filetype/detect.lua#L1524

filetype=tf is not terraform.

comment_regular_data.body: Do not change `server_configurations.md` directly. Edit the lua source file instead. See https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#generating-docs

comment_regular_data.body: Sorry for all the force pushes, just trying to get those checks passing :)

If you think there's an improvement that can be made to the detection for terraform, send a change to vim and it will be backported to https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/5e5b004da44c7075ed1e20ae9d05ab09c6f2ac58/runtime/lua/vim/filetype/detect.lua#L1524-L1535

Oh, I see the filetype is `tf` when the file is empty, otherwise `terraform`.

Funny, sorry for the noise!

title: Fix(terraform): Add 'tf' to filetypes
